articles.headline: Netflix Reports Growth Amid the Backdrop of Two Strikes
articles.snippet: The streaming company’s performance has been helped by its crackdown on password sharing and a relatively new advertising tier introduced last year.
articles.abstract: The streaming company’s performance has been helped by its crackdown on password sharing and a relatively new advertising tier introduced last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Netflix added millions of subscribers in the second quarter and saw a rise in revenue, the company said on Wednesday in an upbeat earnings report that came at a moment when the entertainment industry is dealing with dual strikes inspired in part by the economics of streaming.

articles.headline: Russia Hits Grain Ports and Threatens Ships Headed to Ukraine
articles.snippet: Ukraine accused Moscow of specifically targeting the infrastructure for exporting food, after Russia pulled out of an agreement allowing ships carrying grain to sail past its Black Sea blockade.
articles.abstract: Ukraine accused Moscow of specifically targeting the infrastructure for exporting food, after Russia pulled out of an agreement allowing ships carrying grain to sail past its Black Sea blockade.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Russia resumes its blockade of ships carrying food from Ukraine, its military bombarded Odesa and an adjoining port late Tuesday and early Wednesday — specifically targeting the ability to export grain, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora, Matthew Mpoke Bigg and Joe Rennison

articles.headline: Trump’s Legal Woes Mount as Trial Dates and Campaign Calendar Collide
articles.snippet: The Republican front-runner is facing a growing tangle of criminal and civil trials that will overlap with next year’s presidential primaries.
articles.abstract: The Republican front-runner is facing a growing tangle of criminal and civil trials that will overlap with next year’s presidential primaries.
articles.lead_paragraph: As former President Donald J. Trump campaigns for the White House while multiple criminal prosecutions against him play out, at least one thing is clear: Under the laws of physics, he cannot be in two places at once.

articles.headline: On the Map, Nothing. On the Ground, a Hidden Maya City.
articles.snippet: In a biological preserve in Mexico’s Campeche State, a team of archaeologists has documented pyramids, palaces, a ball court and other remains of an ancient city they call Ocomtún.
articles.abstract: In a biological preserve in Mexico’s Campeche State, a team of archaeologists has documented pyramids, palaces, a ball court and other remains of an ancient city they call Ocomtún.
articles.lead_paragraph: Armed with machetes and chain-saws, hacking through fallen trees and wading through dense scrub, the archaeologists cleared a path down rocky trails.

articles.headline: Why Heat Waves Are Deepening China’s Addiction to Coal
articles.snippet: While pledging to reduce carbon emissions, the country is greatly increasing its use of the fossil fuel to generate electricity.
articles.abstract: While pledging to reduce carbon emissions, the country is greatly increasing its use of the fossil fuel to generate electricity.
articles.lead_paragraph: China has an answer to the heat waves now affecting much of the Northern Hemisphere: burn more coal to maintain a stable electricity supply for air-conditioning.

articles.headline: How TV Writing Became a Dead-End Job
articles.snippet: The writers say Hollywood studios are increasingly limiting their roles in television productions, highlighting a trend for white-collar workers.
articles.abstract: The writers say Hollywood studios are increasingly limiting their roles in television productions, highlighting a trend for white-collar workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the six years he worked on “The Mentalist,” beginning in 2009, Jordan Harper’s job was far more than a writing gig. He and his colleagues in the writers’ room of the weekly CBS drama were heavily involved in production. They weighed in on costumes and props, lingered on the set, provided feedback to actors and directors. The job lasted most of a year.

articles.headline: House Overwhelmingly Passes Bill to Improve Air Travel
articles.snippet: The House cleared away a number of potential sticking points that had threatened to hold up the bill to reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration. It goes next to the Senate.
articles.abstract: The House cleared away a number of potential sticking points that had threatened to hold up the bill to reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration. It goes next to the Senate.
articles.lead_paragraph: The House on Thursday overwhelmingly passed bipartisan legislation to reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration for the next half-decade, moving at a time of growing dysfunction and disruption in the system to make a number of changes that affect passengers.

articles.headline: Inside the Private Writings of Caroline Ellison, Star Witness in the FTX Case
articles.snippet: Ms. Ellison, a top executive in Sam Bankman-Fried’s business empire, recorded her thoughts on private Google documents that offer new insight into the collapse of the FTX crypto exchange.
articles.abstract: Ms. Ellison, a top executive in Sam Bankman-Fried’s business empire, recorded her thoughts on private Google documents that offer new insight into the collapse of the FTX crypto exchange.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three months before the cryptocurrency market imploded last year, Caroline Ellison, the 27-year-old chief executive of the crypto hedge fund Alameda Research, was racked with self-doubt.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: Quick to Mock MAGA, Biden Stays Silent on Trump Indictments
articles.snippet: The president has taken swipes at Republicans, including a video playfully featuring Marjorie Taylor Greene as a narrator, but he and his allies are avoiding one target: his predecessor’s legal woes.
articles.abstract: The president has taken swipes at Republicans, including a video playfully featuring Marjorie Taylor Greene as a narrator, but he and his allies are avoiding one target: his predecessor’s legal woes.
articles.lead_paragraph: For months, President Biden has appeared to delight in needling Donald J. Trump and his Republican allies, trying at every turn to make MAGA and ultra-MAGA a shorthand for the entire party.

articles.headline: An A.I. Supercomputer Whirs to Life, Powered by Giant Computer Chips
articles.snippet: The new supercomputer, made by the Silicon Valley start-up Cerebras, was unveiled as the A.I. boom drives demand for chips and computing power.
articles.abstract: The new supercomputer, made by the Silicon Valley start-up Cerebras, was unveiled as the A.I. boom drives demand for chips and computing power.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inside a cavernous room this week in a one-story building in Santa Clara, Calif., six-and-a-half-foot-tall machines whirred behind white cabinets. The machines made up a new supercomputer that had become operational just last month.

articles.headline: We’re Using A.I. Chatbots Wrong. Here’s How to Direct Them.
articles.snippet: To mitigate the production and spread of misinformation from chatbots, we can steer them toward high-quality data.
articles.abstract: To mitigate the production and spread of misinformation from chatbots, we can steer them toward high-quality data.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anyone seduced by A.I.-powered chatbots like ChatGPT and Bard — wow, they can write essays and recipes! — eventually runs into what are known as hallucinations, the tendency for artificial intelligence to fabricate information.

articles.headline: For Europe’s Older Population, Heat Is the New Covid
articles.snippet: Scorching temperatures have threatened the health of the elderly and pushed them inside, while governments are trying to take extraordinary steps to protect them.
articles.abstract: Scorching temperatures have threatened the health of the elderly and pushed them inside, while governments are trying to take extraordinary steps to protect them.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a light, hot breeze blew through her living room and her gray hair, Donata Grillo, a 75-year-old cancer survivor with a pacemaker and serious sight problems, sat next to her balcony, a damp sponge on her lap.
